thread.section_title: Manchester United not ruling out re-signing Chelsea and Liverpool target Michael Keane – Metro
thread.title: Manchester United not ruling out re-signing Chelsea and Liverpool target Michael Keane
thread.title_full: Manchester United not ruling out re-signing Chelsea and Liverpool target Michael Keane

author: Coral Barry
title: Manchester United not ruling out re-signing Chelsea and Liverpool target Michael Keane
text:
Michael Keane made his England debut on Wednesday (Picture: Getty) Liverpool have reportedly firmed up their interest in Michael Keane after watching the England international flourish in Gareth Southgate’s back three, but face competition from Manchester United.
Jurgen Klopp report card: Heavy metal football yet to strike a chord at Liverpool The Red Devils sold Keane to Burnley after it became apparent the youngster did not have a long-term future at the club.
But less than two years after swapping Old Trafford for Turf Moor, United are exploring whether to re-sign Keane.
Chelsea and Manchester City are monitoring the 24-year-old’s situation with Liverpool at the front of the queue after becoming serious suitors in recent weeks.
Manchester United fixtures West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr
Sunderland (A) – Sun 9 Apr
Anderlecht (A) – Thu 13 Apr
Chelsea (H) – Sun 16 Apr
Anderlecht (H) – Thu 20 Apr
Burnley (A) – Sun 23 Apr
Man City (A) – Thu 27 April
Swansea (A) – Sun 30 April
But the Daily Mail claim United have not ruled out the possibility of resigning the player they let go in the summer of 2015.
Burnely valued the defender at £20 million and have been frustrated in their attempts to tie Keane down to the club.
Michael Keane came through the youth ranks at Manchester United (Picture: Getty) More: Football Arsenal ace names Chelsea star as PL's best player ahead of Sanchez and Ozil 
Ex-Man Utd coach: Mourinho should re-sign former ace who’s BETTER than Bayern Munich star 
Arsenal legend puts Lukas Podolski in his place after bizarre Wenger claim 
Keane has rejected several contract extensions, even one that would make him the highest paid player at Burnley.
The defender will enter the final year on his current deal at the end of the season and is believed to have made winning silverware in the near future a priority.
United will take a cut of any transfer fee Burnley receive should they sell Keane.
MORE: Manchester United should re-sign Michael Keane – he’s better than Mats Hummels, says ex-coach
